results.title: Cricket in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jack Egan, ABC-TV (Australia) and Macmillan Publishing Company
results.brief_description: From the time of the first test, through days of aboriginal teams visiting England, the drama of the bodyline series, and the 1977 World Cricket Series Revolution, Australians have always been ‘cricket mad’. Jack Egan brings together cricket greats to recall highlights of their career, as well as using magnificent archival footage. Special appearances by Ian Chappell, Bill O’Reilly and Lindsay Hassett.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Egan, ABC-TV (Australia) and Macmillan Publishing Company

results.title: Crescent moon = Yueyaer  = 月牙儿
results.creator_credit: An Xiao Hua, Ting Mei, Zhanag Fan, Wang Zhi An, Huo Zhuang, Li Dong De, Xing Dan, Xu Xiaoxing and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Based on a short story written in the 1930s by Lao She, ‘Crescent Moon’ portrays the inexorable injustice exerted by an unfair economic system, through the reminiscences of a young girl gradually forced into prostitution by poverty. Yuerong’s father dies when she is only a little girl; her mother remarries a kind patron, but he dies too. Penury pushes her mother into prostitution, for which Yuerong cannot forgive her. She leaves home and lives at school, but after graduation is unable to find work. She lets a man take care of her for a while, but then discovers he is married. Later she becomes a waitress, but loses the job when she refuses to sleep with the customers. In the end she has no choice but to follow in her mother’s footsteps.

Credits: Directors, Huo Zhuang, Xu Xiaoxing, Xing Dan ; writers, Huo Zhuang, Zhang Fan, Wang Zhi’an ; photography, Sun Cheng, Meng Fanjun ; music, Liv Zhuang ; editing, Zhon Tingmei, An Xiaohua.
Cast: Song Dandan, Siqin Gaowa.

results.title: Cree way
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Mark Zannis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: John Murdock, principal of the Indian Affairs at Rupert House, James Bay, and his wife Gerti, have initiated a curriculum development project using local people and resources. The teaching materials are drawn from Cree folklore, are mainly in Cree, and make use of old photographs, artifacts and books that are written and printed in the community. The school year is organised so that pupils have time to go hunting and fishing with their families. This innovative approach makes local control of education a reality in native communities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ianzelo, Mark Zannis and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Ligong Xu, Bill Kong, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Zoom Hunt International, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Columbia Pictures and Sony Pictures
results.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ang Lee, Ligong Xu, Bill Kong, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Zoom Hunt International, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Columbia Pictures and Sony Pictures
results.description: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai (Chow Yun Fat) and Yu Shu Lien (Michelle Yeoh) are cast as duty bound warriors whose unspoken love for each other spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu (a promising young warrior) and Lo (her bandit lover) represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love. After Li surrenders his legendary sword to Yu and vows to stop fighting, his plans to retire are halted when the sword is stolen. In their quest to recover it, Li and Yu confront the evil forces headed by Jade Fox who is attempting to recruit the impressionable young Jen Yu to her cause. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)
description_for_label: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu (a promising young warrior) and Lo (her bandit lover) represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love. In their quest to recover it, Li and Yu confront the evil forces headed by Jade Fox who is attempting to recruit the impressionable young Jen Yu to her cause. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)

results.title: Cree hunters of Mistassini
results.creator_credit: Boyce Richardson, Tony Ianzelo, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: During the winters, since times pre-dating agriculture, the Cree Indian people of Mistassini have gone to the bush of the James and Ungava Bay area to hunt. Three hunting families agreed to meet an NFBC crew, who filmed the building of the winter camp, the hunting , the relationship to the land, the rhythms of Cree family life. This sensitive film expresses Cree beliefs and ecological principles that are the foundation of their lives. (Awards include: Melbourne, Toronto, London)

results.title: Crossroads Rock Concert
results.creator_credit: Richard Hodder, Salvation Army. Australia Southern Territory and Salvation Army
results.brief_description: Three Christian rock groups gig together in aid of Salvation Army’s Crossroads Program for Homeless Youth, interspersed with modern parables about being young and different from the crowd. “Crossroads” is a video about, and for, contemporary Christian youth.

results.title: Crossroads
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Mark Carliner and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Long ago, Willie Brown bargained his soul with the Devil at the crossroads in return for fame. Gifted young guitarist Eugene (Ralph Maccio) will do anything to play the blues like his legendary hero and travels across country where he meets the now old and cantankerous Willie. Together they journey to the fated crossroads and Eugene learns that to really play the blues, you must live them first. Joe Seneca and Jami Gertz also star in this production which features an incredible soundtrack by Ry Cooder.
